entities: United Nations Monitoring, Verification and Inspection Commission
summary:
The Security Council adopted Resolution 1330 (2000) on December 5, 2000, recalling previous relevant resolutions. 
The Council decided to continue the provisions of Resolution 986 (1995), except for certain paragraphs, for a new 180-day period starting December 6, 2000. 
The aim is to address humanitarian needs in Iraq until the Government fulfills relevant resolutions, including Resolution 687 (1991). 
The Council emphasized the need for equitable distribution of humanitarian supplies to all segments of the Iraqi population. 
It requested the Secretary-General to ensure effective implementation and enhance the UN observation process in Iraq. 
The Secretary-General is to provide comprehensive reports to the Council 90 days after the resolution's entry into force and before the 180-day period ends. 
The Council will review the resolution's implementation and consider renewal, provided satisfactory implementation is reported. 
The Committee established by Resolution 661 (1990) is to report on the implementation of Resolution 986 (1995) arrangements. 
The Council allowed up to $600 million from the escrow account for reasonable expenses related to approved contracts. 
It expressed readiness to consider using $15 million from the escrow account to pay Iraq's arrears in its UN budget contribution, subject to the Government's cooperation.
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
 
9. Requests the Secretary-General to transfer excess funds to increase humanitarian purchases.

10. Directs the Committee to approve lists of basic electricity and housing supplies for the most vulnerable groups in Iraq, exempting these from Committee approval.

11. Requests the Secretary-General to expand and update lists of humanitarian items within 30 days.

12. Decides on a 25% deduction rate for funds deposited in the escrow account to be transferred to the Compensation Fund.

13. Urges the Committee to review applications expeditiously.

14. Urges all States and financial institutions to minimize problems.

15. Requests the Secretary-General to make arrangements to use funds for locally produced goods and oil industry costs.

16. Urges cooperation in implementing this resolution.

17. Calls on Iraq to implement measures.

18. Requests a report on additional export routes.

19. Reiterates a request to update lists of items.

20. Stresses security and safety.
